citation.article-title: Fermentation of S-citramalate, citrate, mesaconate, and pyruvate by a Gram-negative strictly anaerobic non-spore-former, Formivibrio citricus gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Formivibrio gen. nov.
Formivibrio (for.mi.vi'bri.o.M.L.n, acidum formicum formic acid; M. L. masc. n. Vibrio that which vibrates, a generic name; M. L. masc. n. Formivibrio the formic acid forming vibrio)
Curved rod, 1.1-2.5 μm by 0.5-0.6 μm, occurs singly or in pairs.
The ends tapered and rounded to give cashew nut- or kidney-shaped cells.
Motile in an active tumbling manner with a single polar flagellum.
Surface colony colorless, translucent; with a circular form, convex elevation, an entire margin; with a size up to 0.2 mm in diameter.
Gram-negative.
Cell contains β-hydroxymyristic acid (14:0 3OH).
Cell wall contains peptidoglycan of the meso-diaminopimelic acid (m-Dap) directly linked type.
Catalase negative.
Nitrate, sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate, and elemental sulfur not reduced.
Esculin, urea, and gelatin not hydrolyzed.
Indole not produced from tryptophan.
S-Citramalate, citrate, mesaconate, and pyruvate utilized as energy- and carbon-sources.

Not utilized: acetoin, acrylate, citraconate, R-citramalate, crotonate, fumarate, L-glutamate, glycerol, H2/CO2 plus acetate, lactate, DL-threo-β-methylaspartate, L-malate, maleate, oxalate plus acetate, peptone, yeast extract, and carbohydrates.
Temperature relationships: growth range, 30-35°C; no growth at 25 and 40°C.
The pH relationships: growth range, 7.1 -7.9; optimally near 7.6; no growth at 6.7 and 8.2.
Specific growth rate 0.12 h-1 on S-citramalate under the optimal condition.
DNA base ratio: 59 mol% G + C.
Habitat: anoxic freshwater mud.
Type strain: CreCit1 (DSM6150), deposited in Deutsche Sammlung yon Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, FRG.
